runs.comm: fullish ball, angling across the left-handed Amjad, whose feet don't move too much while defending this towards mid-off
slanted a little wider this time, and Amjad leaves it alone
similar, wide of off stump, inviting the drive. This time Amjad goes hard at it and is beaten by the angle

a bit of swing in towards middle stump and Amjad closes his bat face too soon, looking to play through the leg side. Leading edge pops high up in the air, and Amjad is lucky that it's out of reach of mid-off, running towards the boundary
full, a bit of inswing again, and this time he plays with a nice straight bat to defend down the ground
a bit wider now and he reaches out to drive. Plays a touch too early and it runs off the inside half of the bat, towards mid-off

dropped! Taylor puts down a fairly easy catch behind the wicket. Berenger pokes at a back of a length ball that leaves him off the pitch, and Taylor has to reach across to his right, at shoulder height, but he got both gloves to it and it simply popped out
back of a length again, fourth-stump, defended off the back foot
fuller and wider, left alone
length ball outside off and he comes forward to defend into the covers
angles this in towards off stump and he comes forward again, defends towards cover point
length ball on a fifth-stump line, left alone
oh my. More good fortune for UAE. This is back of a length, angling across into the channel, and the uncertain push from Amjad produces the edge, falls just short of Masakadza at slip
now he goes for a big drive outside off. Wasn't a half-volley, and again the angle beats him
length ball on a fourth-stump line. Comes forward to push through the off side with an open face, gets a thick edge that rolls past the diving second slip fielder
full, angling in towards off and middle. Berenger defends towards mid-off
full on middle stump and Berenger clips it uppishly, lots of bottom hand, and he gets it into the gap to the left of mid-on
full outside off. Goes for the big cover drive, ball doesn't quite come on, hits the inside half of his bat and runs away towards mid-on
length ball angling into the body, gets a bit of extra bounce and it hits the thigh pad and drops into the leg side

oh my. What's happening here? Chatara gets a wicket off a no-ball. This time Taylor took a simple catch behind the stumps after Berenger pushed at a length ball outside off, but they check the front foot and it's landed just in front of the crease.
free hit, and Berenger backs away, exposing all his stumps. Chatara tries to follow him with a shortish ball and ends up feeding a short-arm pull to the midwicket boundary
fullish outside off, defended to short extra cover
length ball outside off, straightens and gets some extra bounce. Berenger presses forward and defends towards backward point. Got his head well over that one
angling into the legs this time and that's more runs. Berenger can't connect with the flick but it runs off his thigh pad to the fine leg boundary
a bit fuller along the same angle and Berenger misses another flick. Hit on the pads, a polite appeal. Was clearly going down leg.
full on off stump. Amjad looks to work it towards mid-on, leading edge rolls into the covers
nice length, angling across into the corridor. Amjad gets a good front-foot stride out to defend into the covers
genuine width this time, and although that isn't a half-volley, he can free his arms to drive that through cover, got his wrists into that, drove that in a manner vaguely reminiscent of Salman Butt
a bit of shape in now, quite full again, and he shows the full face to drive it to mid-off
bouncer now, and Amjad ducks safely under it. Replays show he bowled that cross-seam
length ball on off, defended to short extra cover
onto the pads again and it's clipped away to the left of the long leg fielder
fifth-stump line this time and Berenger shoulders arms
shortish ball, angling into the body. He waits on it, gets on his toes, gets on top of the bounce and knocks that down towards third man
good ball, goes wide of the crease and exaggerates the angle across the left-hander. Amjad skips back and across and leaves it with a flourish
and finally the wicket. Amjad waves his bat at a full ball angled across him, away from his body, and the edge flies to second slip, who takes it well, close to his body, falling to his right
length ball angling in towards off, straightens just a touch as Chandran pokes nervily at it. Thick edge runs away towards third man
length ball fairly close to off stump. Well left by Chandran
fullish, angling in towards middle stump, and Chandran clips it towards mid-on
again it's angled into the pads and he tucks it to the left of short midwicket for another quick single
length ball on a fourth-stump line, and he comes forward to block into the off side
fullish on off stump, and he uses the angle to nurdle it into the on side
short ball, he was looking to angle it in and tuck the batsman up but he didn't quite get it right and it slid down the leg side
back to the fuller length, angling into off stump. Chandran pushes it to mid-on
length ball, wide-ish line, left alone
beauty. Angles it in from wide of the crease, forces the batsman to play at it this time and it leaves him off the pitch and beats his outside edge
again that angle but this time it doesn't move so much and Berenger gets a good stride out to defend into the covers
short now, and this time Chatara slides down the leg side. It's quite quick, and it beats Berenger's attempt at a pull
shortish again, outside off this time, and Berenger leaves it alone
full outside off, driven to mid-off
pulls his length back just a touch. Berenger presses forward and makes a good leave
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
a bit wider and Chandran lets it go through to the keeper
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump. Skips across and works it off the hips through backward square leg
fullish on off stump. Berenger pushes forward to defend into the off side
fifth-stump line now and Berenger leaves it for the keeper
quickish, angling in towards middle stump, defended into the on side
length ball on middle and off. Stays on the back foot and works it towards midwicket
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended off the front foot towards mid-off
a bit of loop now, fuller, presses forward to defend
slides on with the angle towards off stump, goes on the back foot to punch down the ground to long-on
a bit fuller, angling in down leg. Plays back again, looking to work it leg side, and it hurries through to hit him on the pads
full on off stump and Berenger punches hard at it, hits it on the up, very firmly, over the umpire's head and too quick for Mire, who reaches out with his right hand but has no chance of catching it
shuffles across now to the full ball on middle, and clips the ball uppishly through midwicket
short down leg, and he's way too early into the pull. Hits him on the glove, ricochets onto the helmet
length ball on off stump, and he gets a good stride out to defend towards mid-off
gone! Another short ball, this time it's outside off, rising, and he has to drag that pull from well over shoulder height. Only manages a thin edge through to Taylor
full, wide tempter, slanting across, inviting the drive. Khurram declines the invitation
full down the leg side, and Chandran can't connect with the flick. Taylor doesn't collect cleanly either. It rolled under his gloves, and he didn't bend low enough
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot towards mid-off
straighter this time and he goes back and across to defend towards short midwicket
fuller now, on middle stump, and he shows the full face and plays it with the angle, to the right of mid-on
back of a length, would have been the perfect line to the right-hander but it's down the leg side to the left-handed Khurram
very full outside off, too full for the cover drive, and Khurram gets a thick inside edge that just misses off stump and races to the fine leg boundary
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hips to the left of square leg
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, blocked towards cover
full and the angle gives him a lot of width. Khurram drives it crisply, on the up, to the right of the cover fielder
back of a length outside off, dabbed to gully
short now, sits up, and he swivels on his toes to pull that away to the backward square leg boundary
back of a length on the hips, tucked to short midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
tossed up slow on off stump, defended into the on side
a touch shorter now and he goes back and plays with the angle towards short midwicket
slow and flighted outside off, pushed back to the bowler. No turn again
back of a length outside off, punched down to long-off
loopy delivery on off stump, got some drift away from the left-hander there, but he comfortably drives it to long-on
tosses it up again, angling in towards off stump. Chandran clips it to long-on
flighted delivery on middle stump, driven down the ground, straight into the stumps at the other end
short and wide and he reaches out to cut, ends up slicing it into the gap to the left of backward point
back of a length, sliding in towards off stump, defended into the off side
slower now, fuller, and he comes forward to block it back to the bowler
slow again, this time he waits for it and punches firmly to mid-off
back of a length, some width outside off this time, and he gets it into the gap, punching it between point and cover
tossed up on middle and off, worked away to the left of midwicket
tossed up nice and slow on off stump, driven to long-off
on the pads, tucked away to the right of short fine leg
length ball, sliding in with the angle towards middle and leg. It tucks up Chandran for room as he goes on the back foot to punch through the off side, but he adjusts and punches it to long-on
down the track comes Khurram now, skipping away from the line to give himself a bit of room and drive it up and over the covers. Excellent shot
length ball on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length now, blocked to short midwicket
fuller this time, on off stump, and he gets forward to defend into the covers
short ball, pulled away to deep backward square leg
tossed up on off, and that drive was going for a single to long-off but Kamungozi throws himself to his left and makes an excellent save
back of a length, hurries through towards middle and off. Defended towards short midwicket
length ball outside off. Khurram goes on the back foot and punches towards short extra cover
slanted across a bit fuller, towards off, and he comes forward to defend back to the bowler
a touch shorter and he rocks back to punch, straight back to the bowler
short and wide this time and Khurram puts it away with ease, cutting crisply to the backward point boundary
full on middle stump, whipped to the left of midwicket, where the fielder makes a diving stop
slowish length ball on off stump, tucks it with the angle to square leg
length ball on off stump, defended with the (slight) turn towards midwicket
a touch shorter, on leg stump, tucked away towards square leg
full outside off, lets it hang in the air a bit, and it's pushed back firmly to the bowler
on the pads now, worked to the left of square leg
length ball angled across the left-hander, who pushes it with soft hands in front of short cover and calls his partner through for the quick single
shortish outside off and Chandran plays the topspin forehand down the ground to long-on
fullish on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball outside off, driven on the up to short cover
angles this in towards off stump and he looks to clip towards mid-on. Mire sprints across quickly to stop it and then gives up an overthrow with an unnecessary throw at the stumps
back of a length, too straight, worked off the hips to long leg
short ball outside off, tennis-ball bounce through to Taylor after the batsman leaves it
full outside off, and Karate throws his hands at the drive but his feet move too sluggishly for him to get close enough to make contact
full outside off, driven down to long-off
a bit of flight outside off and he drives it past the stumps with a lot of bottom hand
nice flight again, a bit of drift away from the left-hander and it continues along that path. Khurram looked to push towards mid-off, gets a thick outside edge towards backward point
full again, driven back firmly, hits the stumps at the other end
length ball on middle stump, turns in and tucks him up for room as he goes back to punch. Has to check his shot and push it back towards the bowler
fuller now, wider, driven to point
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, whipped to short midwicket from a one-legged prancing position
looked to work it from outside off again, and the ball straightened, bounced extra and opened him up, beating his outside edge
doesn't stop him from shuffling across and working this back of a length ball from outside off, gets it into the gap at square leg
ooh. That was angled across towards off and it straightened a bit as he came halfway forward to defend. Hit his inside edge, then his pad, and bounced over the stumps
back of a length on off stump. Khurram gets on his toes to steer it to third man
short ball and it catches Chandran halfway between fending and pulling. Manages to play that away towards backward square leg
length ball, slides on towards off stump. Chandran tucks it away to short midwicket
a bit of air and he skips down the pitch to whip it to long-on
length ball on the pads and he walks across to try and help it past short fine leg. Hits it in the air, nearly carries through to the fielder on the full
on the [pads again, tucked towards short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, just enough turn to deny him room, and he punches it down to mid-off
a touch of width this time and he leans back to steer that into the gap wide of point
length ball angling in towards off stump. Familiar shuffle and clip from Chandran towards short midwicket

another length ball on off and he plays this with a straight bat to mid-on, checks his shot just enough to allow a quick single. Actually, not quite. Direct hit from Mire and he would have been out at the bowler's end.
back of a length on middle stump. Khurram stays inside the line and opens his bat face to dab it towards point
short outside off. Looks to pull, ends up plonking it down into the pitch, and it rolls towards short midwicket
down the track now and he clears his front leg to slog that towards the midwicket boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
length ball slanted across Khurram, who stretches forward and dabs it to short third man
back of a length on off stump, punched to short cover
looks for the sweep and Kamungozi gets some extra bounce, top edge loops over the keeper, goes in a perfectly straight line behind the wicket
nice change of pace, a bit slower on middle and off. Looks to drive with the angle but it dips and turns in and he inside-edges it into his pads
a bit quicker now, turns in again and tucks him up for room, punches it back to the bowler
on the pads now and he tucks it away to short fine leg
back of a length, worked off the hips through square leg
full, down the leg side. Chandran can't connect with the flick
length ball outside off and he looks to work it with the angle to mid-on. Raza dives from short midwicket to cut it off and save the single
bouncer wide outside off, wide enough for the umpire to signal wide
full-toss angling into the pads, whipped away to long leg
back of a length outside off, chopped away down to third man
shortish outside off, doesn't quite come on for the punch through cover. Ends up pushing it to mid-off
full outside off, plays with a straight bat, with the angle, down to long-on
quickish, turns and hits him on the pads as he looked to work it leg side. Turning down leg
on the pads again, worked into the on side
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
a bit of loop outside off, looks to push that to long-off but Raza dives to intercept
down the track now, drives firmly this time to beat the flying Raza and hit it down to long-off
clears his front leg this time as Raza bowls it on the stumps and swats it away, on one knee, to the midwicket boundary
and he strikes immediately. Down the track comes Chandran, goes for the big hit down the ground. Doesn't middle it at all, and pops a simple catch to mid-off

back of a length outside off and he dabs it with an open face, point dives to his right to stop it, but can't release the ball quick enough to exploit a mix-up that left Khurram halfway down the pitch
short outside off, left alone
full and wide and he leans into a sweet-looking drive, simply caressed to the right of the cover fielder
length ball now, on a similar line with a bit of outswing. Patil isn't suckered into another drive, leaves it alone
full outside off, and he shows the full face to use the angle and punch it towards the vacant long-on region. Mid-off runs back to cut it off
full, angling in towards off stump. Khurram drives to short cover
down the track now, drives with a full follow-through down to long-off
full on off stump, clipped down to long-on
full-toss on middle stump, whipped straight to midwicket
fullish outside off, looks for the drive to long-off but short cover dives across to save the single
a bit of turn and Khurram has to reach away from his body to slap that, can't beat the man at point

short rising ball, angling into the body, and Patil does well to get up on his toes and keep that down with soft hands. Hit the handle and he dropped his bottom hand just in time to avoid a nasty finger jam
shortish again, outside off, steered away to deep point
another one banged in outside off. Patil leaves it alone
back of a length, angling in, and he tucks it away wristily to long leg
back of a length on off stump and he opens his bat face to use the angle and dab it down to third man
full on off stump, punched to mid-on

taken! That's plucked out of the air by Williams, diving to his right from point, as Khurram fails to keep this cut down. It was short and wide, but Charara got that to bounce a little more than the batsman expected
full, angling into middle stump, and he's nearly lbw as he's late on the flick. Gets an inside edge on it
shortish outside off and he hops and pokes it awkwardly towards backward point
fuller now, angling in towards off stump. Shaiman gets forward to defend into the covers
short ball, quick, beats Shaiman for pace as he goes for the hook
another attempted hook, again it whizzes past him too quick to connect
tossed up on middle stump, whipped away to long-on
spears this in towards the pads and he goes on the back foot to nudge it wide of short midwicket
a bit fuller and he comes on the front foot and lets it come on to tuck it towards short fine leg
keeps a bit low as he makes a bit of room to punch but he manages to play the shot, into the gap between point and cover
slanted into the pads again, worked towards square leg
on the pads once more, tucked away to deep square leg
full outside off, looks to drive through cover, inside-edges it into the leg side
shortish, angling into the body. He jumps in the air, away from the stumps, to defend into the off side
short again, this time he hooks it from head height, outside off, towards deep midwicket
another bouncer, this time Patil ducks under it
full outside off and he opens his bat face to steer it to backward point
length ball on off stump, defended to cover
round-arm, goes wide of the crease, angles it too far down the leg side as the batsman looks to sweep
full again, slanting down leg. This time Shaiman's front leg is in the way as he misses the flick
sliding down leg again, clipped towards fine leg
down the track now, driven down to long-off
back of a length and he makes room to slap that away from a middle-stump line and find the cover boundary. Top shot
full and wide and he reaches out to steer it into the gap to the left of point
back of a length again, keeps a bit low and he can only punch it straight to short extra cover
tossed up, looks to drive this to long-off but the diving Raza gets in the way
wider this time and he drives it to sweeper cover
on the pads now, clipped to long-on
full and flighted, driven back towards the non-striker and Raza quickly moves to his left to cut it off
now it's a bit straighter and he looks for the checked drive to long-on. Again Raza is vigilant enough to cut it off
tossed up outside off, driven to short cover
short ball, pulled away towards deep square leg
short, angling down leg, and he only has to help this freebie along to find the fine leg boundary
back of a length outside off, and he can't quite beat backward point. Was looking to open his bat face and run it down to third man
length ball, wide outside off, finds the edge as Patil throws his bat at it, but it races away to the third man boundary
length ball on off stump, dabbed away to cover point, can't get the single he wanted
short outside off, looks to dab that to third man, the ball bounces more than expected and beats his outside edge
too short, a bit of width as well, and Shaiman transfers his weight beautifully through the ball to carve that up and over cover point
Fuller now, on off stump, defended into the off side
Low full-toss on leg stump and that's swept away easily to the long leg boundary
Back of a length outside off, flat-batted to long-off
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed towards point

shortish outside off and he leans back and opens his bat face to steer it into the gap to the right of the man at short third man. He dives and gets a hand to it but can't stop the boundary. Not the greatest effort from Kamungozi.
length ball on off stump and he walks across to work that away towards deep backward square leg
on the pads now and it's whipped away to deep square leg
slower ball, slides it down the leg side
length ball on off stump, looks to clip it for a single but short midwicket is quick to run in and cut it off
fullish on off stump and he clears his front leg to make room and slices it inside-out over the covers
length ball on off stump and he plonks his front leg forward to sweep, can't beat short fine leg
full outside off and once again he clears his front leg and carves it over cover to pick up another four
length ball outside off, dabs it to short third man with an open face
full outside off, driven down to long-off
in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped away to the left of short fine leg
length ball on off stump, clipped with the angle to short midwicket
length ball outside off and he looks for the flat-batted slap down the ground. Can't beat mid-off, though
short ball, and that pull is controlled beautifully, moved across past the line of the ball and swivelled to find the gap wide of short fine leg
length ball on off stump and that is a stunning shot. Clears his front leg and launches that down the ground for six to bring up a 37-ball half-century. Super innings this from Anwar
full on the pads, clipped away through square leg
length ball outside off and he presses forward looking for the quick single into the off side. Short cover moves swiftly to rule out that option
length ball on leg stump, can't beat short fine leg with the sweep
back of a length outside off, and Patil opens his bat face to place it adroitly, just wide of the keeper and it runs away to the third man boundary
length ball outside off, driven to short extra cover
a bit fuller, closer to off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length again, on off stump, pushed to mid-off for the quick single

back of a length, makes some room and slaps it away to the backward point boundary. Mire, running to his left from the sweeper position, ends up palming it into the boundary in the effort to bend down and scoop up the ball
down the track now, and Williams spears it into his feet. Clips it down to long-on for one
length ball, angling in towards off and middle. Goes on the back foot and pushes it back to the bowler
a bit straighter this time and he works it away towards fine leg
Williams breaks through. Patil makes room to go inside-out over cover, wasn't quite to the pitch of the ball, and he ends up scooping it straight into cover's hands
on the pads, worked away towards deep backward square leg
tossed up on off stump, worked away wide of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, dabs it with the angle towards third man
length ball, a lot of width outside off, slapped away towards deep point
premeditated the lap-scoop and Masakadza bowled it wide of off stump. Gets an outside edge on it and it loops over the keeper and runs away to the third man boundary
full outside off, driven towards short extra cover
full on off stump and he makes room to slice that in the air towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, steered away to third man
sees him coming down the track and bangs it in short. Goes for a tennis-style smash but can't connect
very short and it sails high over the batsman's head
length ball on leg stump, tucked away towards short midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed away towards short third man
and that's wicket number three for Chatara. Back of a length, slanting across, and Mustafa looks to run it down to third man with an open face, and can only nick it to the keeper
back of a length outside off, guided away to third man
slower ball, full on off stump, chipped in the air down to long-on
gone! That was full, angling into middle and leg. He cleared his front leg to launch that down the ground but didn't get the elevation, spooned a simple catch to mid-on
flat and full on middle stump, and he nearly plays down the wrong line while defending, off the outside edge to short third man
flat and quick again, and this time he defends to cover
slower now and he presses forward to block into the off side

back of a length outside off and he dabs it to short third man, who makes a good diving stop but undoes some of his good work by throwing to the keeper's end when Naveed was struggling to make the bowler's end
full now, driven to mid-off
length ball on middle stump and he clears his front leg, makes a lot of room, in fact, and frees his arms to launch that high over the long-off boundary. Lovely clean strike
short ball now as Naveed steps away to make room. Looks to pull but can't connect
banged in short outside off, Naveed looks to ramp it but it's too far over his head to make contact
slower ball now, just outside off, and it beats Naveed as he steps away and looks to slog over the leg side
another slower ball and the flummoxed Naveed can only block it into the off side
makes room again and Chatara bowls it short. Naveed swivels through a pull and makes excellent contact, easily clears the leg-side boundary
slower ball outside off and Naveed, making room to slice through the off side, can't make contact
fullish on off stump, blocked to short extra cover
tossed up slower and he clears his front leg to slice that over cover
makes a lot of room, exposes all his stumps, and carves this out to sweeper cover
sees him make room again and fires it quicker and wider to beat the attempted flat-bat slap
full on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket
on the pads, tucked away towards deep square leg
low full-toss on middle and leg and he gives himself room to poke that away to sweeper cover
slower ball, follows the batsman as he backs away outside leg, and he slogs and misses
slower ball, again he follows the batsman. This time he manages to heave it away towards deep square leg
excellent yorker now, and he can only dig it back towards the bowler
gives himself room again, drives the leg-stump yorker down to long-off
low full-toss on leg stump, swiped away towards deep square leg
full on off stump and Javed makes room and scoops it over cover and finds the boundary
and again, this time it's hit much more cleanly, flatter, and it goes straighter. Long-off didn't have too far to move to his left but he had no chance of cutting it off
in the blockhole on off stump and he pokes it to the man at extra cover
looks for the blockhole, can't find it, and Javed gets inside the line and lifts it casually over the wide long-off boundary. Made that look so easy
slower ball now, angling in and cramping the batsman, who slogged it high in the air over the leg side, falls well out of reach of the fielder running back from midwicket
comes down the track and Panyangara bangs it in short. Swings and misses and the umpire calls it wide. Was it really that high? It probably was, as replays from square-on suggest
full, just a bit of width outside off, and he carves it over cover point and picks up another boundary. 21 off that over.

slower ball and that's some more poor keeping from Taylor. It was the slower one, the batsman swung and missed, and he should have been prepared for the ball to roll through to him. He didn't stay low, and it beat Taylor and ran away for four byes
full on off stump, slapped straight to cover
sees the batsman make room, follows him with a short ball. He goes for the pull, and gets a helpful top-edge over short fine leg
full, aiming at the batsman's retreating feet. Another swing and miss
good yorker, and he manages to squeeze it away towards deep square leg
another yorker, clipped away to the right of long-on and he ends the innings with a couple
